criteria: Ability to clearly and confidently communicate refusal.
Ability to provide a reason for refusal.
Ability to suggest an alternative or redirect the situation.
Ability to recognize and respond to different types of pressure (e.g., peer pressure, direct requests, subtle persuasion).
descriptions: Unable to communicate refusal or demonstrates significant discomfort/hesitation.
Communicates refusal unclearly and with hesitation; relies on passive or indirect language.
Communicates refusal with some clarity, but lacks confidence or uses unclear body language.
Communicates refusal clearly and confidently in most situations; maintains appropriate eye contact and body language.
Communicates refusal very clearly and confidently in a variety of situations; uses assertive language and strong nonverbal cues.
Communicates refusal exceptionally clearly, confidently, and respectfully in all situations; adapts approach to context and demonstrates exemplary assertiveness.
Unable to provide any reason for refusal.
Provides a vague or unclear reason for refusal.
Provides a reason for refusal, but it is not well-articulated or convincing.
Provides a clear and reasonable explanation for refusal.
Provides a clear and convincing reason for refusal that aligns with personal values and boundaries.
Provides a compelling and well-reasoned explanation for refusal, demonstrating strong self-awareness and ethical considerations.
Does not attempt to suggest an alternative or redirect the situation.
Suggests an alternative that is inappropriate, unsafe, or does not effectively redirect the situation.
Suggests an alternative, but it is weak or easily dismissed.
Suggests a reasonable alternative or way to redirect the situation.
Suggests a creative and effective alternative that respects boundaries and promotes positive outcomes.
Masterfully redirects the situation with a well-thought-out alternative that diffuses pressure and prioritizes personal safety and well-being.
Does not recognize or respond to pressure.
Shows limited awareness of pressure and struggles to respond effectively.
Recognizes some types of pressure, but response is inconsistent or ineffective.
Recognizes and responds appropriately to common types of pressure.
Skillfully navigates various types of pressure with confidence and resilience.
Demonstrates exceptional insight into different types of pressure and consistently responds with sophisticated and ethical strategies.
